intro: Napoleonaea reptans, commonly known as the creeping napoleonaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes and spread along the ground. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Napoleonaea reptans is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in damp forests.
